alert.note: Alert for Chester; Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 4:24PM EST until December 19 at 5:39AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Brandywine Creek At Chadds Ford affecting Delaware and Chester Counties. For the Brandywine Creek...including Chadds Ford...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Brandywine Creek at Chadds Ford. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Open adjacent land next to the creek floods. At 10.0 feet, The intersections of Creek Road and Route 926 near Pocopson floods upstream of Chadds Ford. At 11.8 feet, Brandywine River Museum begins to take on water. Route 1 also takes on water. At 12.0 feet, Businesses upstream of the gage begin to flood. At 13.0 feet, Residential evacuations begin at this stage. Route 1 and Route 100 are closed. Fairville Road is also closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 PM EST Monday was 12.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 3.1 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.3 feet on 10/09/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Brandywine Creek Chadds Ford 9.0 12.2 Mon 3 pm 5.0 3.4 11.2 7 pm 12/18 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 430 AM EST.
